title: (x) Tattoo-like scripts on T-shirt by Mister Cartoon - various {gang}
content:
Hi, im new to all of this so apologies for any stupid comments or blatently obvious questions i may come out with.

Anyway, to the point, im looking to get a tattoo in a few days, and am looking for a few fonts, or fonts similar to the ones im looking at.

The first of which is this piece, created by Mister Cartoon:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130106073723im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cartoonw_6339_6034.jpg)
  
The font in which the cities are written in would be ideal, i know its custom work, but if anybody could point me in the direction of a similar font, that would be brilliant.

I am a big fan of Mister cartoons work, and the lettering in most of his tattoos is what im looking for. Any help towards finding the right font for my tattoo would be brilliant.

Thanks, Rob
author: Robspink

comments.content:
Hi Rob,

check out the offerings of [Ale Paul & Co](http://web.archive.org/web/20130106073723/http:/www.sudtipos.com/home).  
F

——  
 [Please use a descriptive title next time! Thank you.](http://web.archive.org/web/20130106073723/http:/typophile.com/forum/typeid/faq/#Q_2 "Frequently Asked Question – What do I enter in the “Title” line?")

Thanks for the link above, there are a few nice fonts on there although not quite what i'm looking for.

I'v noticed alot of tattoos in the U.S.A written in a similar font, especially in the L.A area.

I heard that it was a Hydro74 font although i cant find it there either.

Any suggestions ?

[http://hydro74.com/H74/typetreatments.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20130106073723/http:/hydro74.com/H74/typetreatments.php "http://hydro74.com/H74/typetreatments.php")

A few similar fonts on there, although i dont believe any of them are available to buy :(

You might explore through some of Eduardo Recife's work: [http://www.misprintedtype.com/v4/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130106073723/http:/www.misprintedtype.com/v4/ "http://www.misprintedtype.com/v4/")

House always has stylish scripts: [http://www.houseind.com/fonts/studiolettering](http://web.archive.org/web/20130106073723/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/studiolettering "http://www.houseind.com/fonts/studiolettering")

Veer's got some great choices as well, among them this one: Liza Pro  
 [http://www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000499](http://web.archive.org/web/20130106073723/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000499 "http://www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000499")

[BB Skin Deep](http://web.archive.org/web/20130106073723/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/blambot/skin-deep-bb/) has a similar feel.

A lot of the scripts on Hydro74 are embellished versions of existing fonts (Hot Wheels, Autobahn and Armed Muzik are based on [Sloop](http://web.archive.org/web/20130106073723/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/sloop/); Mighty Muggs looks like [Sarah Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20130106073723/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/charlesborges/sarah-script/)).

Robspink  
Maybe Piel Script helps you  
 [http://sudtipos.com/fonts/142](http://web.archive.org/web/20130106073723/http:/sudtipos.com/fonts/142 "http://sudtipos.com/fonts/142")
